title: Kaluza launches new smart charging trial with Fiat
lead: ​Kaluza has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with automaker Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) to develop a ‘cheaper, simpler and more sustainable’ electric vehicle (EV) charging services.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: SSE to treble renewable output as it releases strong interim results
lead: ​SSE is set to treble its renewable output by 2030 thanks to an attractive pipeline of projects, and is on track to add 1GW of new capacity annually in the second half of the decade.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Investment must double to £400bn over next decade for UK to reach net zero
lead: ​For the UK to reach its net zero target, £40 billion a year will be needed in infrastructure spending, double current levels.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: October sees a quarter of a million smart meters installed in 2020 high
lead: ​The number of smart meters rolled out in October hit a record high, with almost a quarter of a million installations.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ten Point Plan reactions: A ‘vital step forward’, but does it go far enough?
lead: Companies, groups and charities operating in the energy and environmental space gave Current± their reactions to the long awaited ‘milestone’ of a plan.

title: ICE ban brought forward to 2030 in ‘landmark moment’ as Johnson releases Ten Point Plan
lead: ​Prime Minister Boris Johnson has released his eagerly awaited Ten Point Plan for a Green Industrial revolution, setting out pledges to create 250,000 jobs.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: NewMotion partners Europcar to provide ecosystem of charging solutions
lead: ​NewMotion has announced a new partnership with Europcar Mobility Group to provide a what it has labelled as a complete ecosystem of charging solutions.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: SSEN awards Opus One Solutions contract to develop new flexibility market solutions
lead: ​Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (SSEN) has awarded Opus One Solutions a contract to develop and deploy solutions to test different flexibility market models.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Current± Chats: NewMotion’s Melanie Lane on the green recovery and the EV sector's tipping point
lead: Current± caught up with Lane to find out what her first impressions of the industry are, the impact of the green recovery, and what’s next for NewMotion.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Tritium unveils ‘world first’ scalable EV hardware platform along with next-gen DC fast charger
lead: ​Tritium has unveiled a new platform for scaling electric vehicle (EV) networks, in what it is says is a world first.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ENW announces its largest flexibility to date calling for 122MW
lead: ​Electricity North West (ENW) has put out its largest flexibility tender ever, seeking up to 122MW of flexibility.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Social Energy begins global expansion in Australia in partnership with Duracell
lead: UK smart energy supplier Social Energy has begun it’s global expansion, offering a completely green energy package with an exclusive Duracell home solar battery system in Australia.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Current± launches 2020 readership survey
lead: Current± is today launching its 2020 readership survey, canvassing readers for its feedback publisher Solar Media makes plans for the forthcoming year.
author: Current± Staff

title: SSE, ScottishPower and National Grid announced as Principal Partners for COP26
lead: ​Energy majors SSE, ScottishPower and National Grid, together with the NatWest Group have been announced as the first sponsors of the COP26 climate change summit.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UK government eyes the skies with space-based solar power research
lead: ​The UK government is looking at the possibility of beaming clean, solar power down from space as it looks to develop further resilient, safe and sustainable energy sources.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: WPD releases real-time power flow data to aid operational decisions as it increases digitalisation
lead: ​Western Power Distribution (WPD) has released its new Real-Time Power Flow Data Access as it looks to ramp up its digitalisation programme.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: M&G cash injection of £150m to boost Zenobe battery portfolio by additional 500MWh
lead: ​Zenobe Energy is targeting an additional 500MWh of storage and 1,000 electric buses following a £150 million investment from Infrascapital, the infrastructure equity investment arm of M&G.
author: Alice Grundy

title: 'Exciting milestone' passed for clean heat project combining river source heat pump, solar and storage
lead: ​A project bringing together a river source heat pump, solar, storage and combined heat and power (CHP) has taken a step forward.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Public support for renewables reaches 80% as solar comes out on top
lead: ​Public opinion on renewables has remained high throughout 2020 with 80%​ stating they now support renewable generation.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Government sets sights on 2 million new green jobs with creation of taskforce
lead: ​The government has announced the formation of the Green Jobs Taskforce to support the creation of 2 million new jobs.
author: Alice Grundy
